Sequence Information.Peptide Name: BDEF_TACTR (Big defensin; UCSS1a; 3S=S, natural AMPs; Horseshoe Crab, arachnids, Cheliceratas, arthropods, invertebrates, animals)

Literature Information.Literature: Structure: The disulfide array is identical to that of beta-defensins from bovine neutrophils.You can rotate, zoom, and view the 3D structureherein the PDB.Activity: active against Gram+ and Gram- bacteria as well as fungi such as C. albicans.SAR: Tryptic digestion led to two fragments. The N-terminal fragment displays a more potent activity against Gram-positive bacteria, whereas the C-terminal fragment is more potent against Gram-negative bacteria. Updated 2/2014; 3/2023.
Literature Information.Author: Saito T, Kawabata S, Shigenaga T, Takayenoki Y, Cho J, Nakajima H, Hirata M, Iwanaga S.1995
Literature Information.Title: A novel big defensin identified in horseshoe crab hemocytes: isolation, amino acid sequence, and antibacterial activity.
